domino-robot.title: Limit Switch not triggering
domino-robot.message:
People have found these help:

1. Spreading a small drop of dish soap across the
metal bar to reduce friction.

2. Tying a knot in the badge reel so the knot hits the limit switch just before the red square gets stuck on the wall.

3. Filing down the corner

4. Using a thin rubber band to pull on the red square with more force

domino-robot.title: Buy More Dominos
domino-robot.message: You can buy them at https://bulkdominoes.com/ or you can 3d print them: https://www.printables.com/model/1057620-hack-pack-domino

domino-robot.title: Domino IR Control
domino-robot.message:
Instructions and code for adding IR control to the domino robot are here: https://discord.com/channels/1229106258749948056/1257938635295031366/1257938635295031366

A video explaining this further can be found at https://youtu.be/WLICyCNntyY

domino-robot.title: Domino Robot Not Turning On
domino-robot.message:
Check for backwards red and black wires, and backwards H-Bridge wires. This can cause a short, and can make the Arduino's red `PWR` flash for a second.

If all yours wires are all correct, make sure your battery is charged.

general.title: How to Be Successful at Learning Microcontrollers
Domino Bad Bootloader Batch
general.message:
```
Yeah, use the turret arduino for now, it seems that a batch of arduinos had their bootloaders corrupted. If you have the wires, you could do this https://discord.com/channels/1229106258749948056/1304473086560829481/1304473086560829481

Otherwise if you don't have the hardware for that you could DM Tom for a replacement arduino
```

general.title: Subscription Delivery Schedule & Renewal
general.message: For Hack Pack boxes, you will get one box every other month, starting from when you purchased the subscription. The next year, when your subscription auto renews or when you manually renew it, you will start receiving the next set of 6 new level 2 boxes.

general.title: Arduino red light blinking on full battery
general.message: If the `PWR` light is blinking on the arduino, that likely means something is shorting. Check that you don't have any backwards black and red wires.

general.title: Connecting an Ultrasonic Sensor to the Breadboard
Crunchlabs Trophy Case Website Link
general.message: The CrunchLabs Trophy Case has not yet been pushed live to the website yet, however everything in it is pulled from the `#featured-hacks` channels in this server, so check those out.

general.title: All Known Boxes
general.message: A list of all boxes we know of can be found at https://discord.com/channels/1229106258749948056/1245218219233382461/1312093917289779272

ide.title: Allow IDE without administrator
ide.message: Best option is Arduino IDE. Alternative would be modifying some security settings per https://discord.com/channels/1229106258749948056/1262069792643219536/1262917038293389444

ide.title: Device Manager
ide.message: open "Device Manager" and check if you have an "Unknown Device" or "Serial USB" or "CH340..." or such under "Other Devices", "USB...", or "Ports and Coms" categories

ide.title: IDE Not Connecting Checklist
ide.message:
1. Watch https://ide.crunchlabs.com/downloads
2. Use Chrome.
3. Use provided USB cable.
4. Connecting cable to silver USB-C on arduino, not black breadboard box.
5. Reload webpage.
6. Try in incognito mode
7. Turn off bluetooth then restart your computer.
8. Try *multiple* other USB-A to USB-C cables.
9. Go to http://127.0.0.1:8991/ and try the "list" command
10. Worst case, try the Arduino IDE.

- Others:
If the upload button is disabled, make sure `Monitor` is *off*

ide.title: Raspberry Pi Create Agent
ide.message:
I recommend using the Arduino IDE 2 instead.

However to use the crunchlabs version, link to raspberry pi create agent binary and install instructions:
https://discord.com/channels/1229106258749948056/1245199999164350556/1285779167886966884

ide.title: Create Agent support on Linux
ide.message: The Crunchlabs Create Agent does not support linux, however it is just a branded version of the [Arduino Create Agent](https://github.com/arduino/arduino-create-agent), which runs on linux. Once you install and start this, right-click the icon in your system tray, select "Open Config", you'll need to add "https://ide.crunchlabs.com/" to the `origins` array in the config.

ide.title: Serial Monitor Not Working
ide.message:
If the Serial Monitor is not working, first make sure you have monitor on. If you have it turned on and it still is not working, it might be due to conflicts with driver versions, follow the steps here to resolve 
https://discord.com/channels/1229106258749948056/1318809015924555827/1321595906612793366

ide.title: Create Agent Install On Mac Guide
ide.message: Once you download the agent at https://ide.crunchlabs.com/downloads, you need to go to Finder -> Downloads -> Find the CrunchLabsArduinoCreateAgent -> Open -> Drag the CreateAgent Icon into the Applications Folder -> Go back to Finder -> Applications -> CrunchlabsArduinoCreateAgent -> Open. The CreateAgent does not have a window that opens when you open it, it runs in the background. You can check to make sure it is running by looking at your system tray in the top right. If you see a black circle with the Hack Pack logo on it, then it is running. Also make sure to use chrome as Safari will not work unless you want to mess with your settings as described here https://discord.com/channels/1229106258749948056/1261395362963263488

ide.title: CH340 Driver
ide.message: The latest CH340 driver can be installed here <https://www.arduined.eu/ch340-windows-10-driver-download>

ide.title: Reflash Bootloader (fix stk500_getsync error)
ide.message:
if you are getting the stk500_getsync error, first make sure you are using the provided cable, other cables can cause this issue.

If you are using the proper cable and the issue still occurs, see this thread for mor information about the issue and https://discord.com/channels/1229106258749948056/1342582839736012843/1342582839736012843. 

Before requesting a replacement arduino, make sure uploading works on a different arduino, confirming it is an arduino issue, not a computer issue.

ide.title: Fix IDE ReadOnly
ide.message:
To get out of read-only mode on the IDE, click the Level 2 or Level 3 tabs.

Level 1 is viewing the code only, no editing. 
Level 2 only allows editing some variable values.
Level 3 is full access to write the code.

label.title: Running Extremely Slow
label.message:
Flash the label code to the domino arduino. You can use the video at https://ide.crunchlabs.com/downloads to set it up.
If it works with the domino arduino, try reflashing code to the label arduino, if it still isn't working send a DM to @ tom_crunchlabs with your shipping address and he'll send you a replacement arduino for free.

label.title: Stepper Axis Will Not Move
label.message: Push the Arduino firmly into breadboard, it will likely click into place if it wasn't already. Try it again, if it still doesn't work, try swapping which motor is plugged into which driver. (You might have to unscrew the driver from the wall). See if the issue swaps to the other motor (which means the driver is the issue) or if the issue stays on the same axis (which means the motor is the issue).

label.title: Visual Character Editor
label.message: Here is a link to a tutorial on how to create custom characters https://discord.com/channels/1229106258749948056/1275557292472795136/1275557292472795136

label.title: Generic Screen Issues Debugging
label.message:
If your screen is showing random letters or showing lights but no letters, reading through this thread contains debugging steps for most issues: https://discord.com/channels/1229106258749948056/1281377595035746408/1281377595035746408

If the screen's backlight isn't turning on, check to make sure the black and red wires to the LCD are secure first

label.title: Label Prank Code text replacement
label.message: The label maker has an official code modification  that swaps one word that was typed out with a different word when printed. Instructions for how to do this are linked here https://discord.com/channels/1229106258749948056/1361022296763928646/1361022296763928646

laser.title: Swap Gun and Goggles
laser.message: First, unplug the gun from the goggles on each and swap it. Keep track of which gun does not work. If the same gun does not work, it's on the gun side (IR emitter) that it is not working, if it swaps to being the other gun, it is on the goggle side (IR receiver) that it is not working.

laser.title: Generic Laser Tag Not Working
laser.message: If neither laser gun can shoot the other, and they are not reacting to each other, the issue is almost always that they have not been set to both run on different teams. To set them to different teams, the short green wire should connect the black ground rail with A1, A2, or A3 to indicate whether the gun is on team 1, 2, or 3.

sandy.title: Bead Chain Tightness Issues
sandy.message:
If one chain is too tight and one is too loose, the bottom chain is on the wrong side of the orange standoff by the gears. Take it off and move it to the other side.

If both are too tight, you might have the orange motor-holder on backwards.

turret.title: D9 Breadboard Bypass
turret.message: Try this: Pull the multicolored wires out of the breadboard and hold the tips of the purple wire directly against pin D9, we want to see if the green light turns off

turret.title: Recode Turret For Different Remote
turret.message: To use a different remote for the turret, or to make any button preform any action you want such as firing, you will need to setup the turret to print all remote button value it receives. Then you will have to look at the button value, and modify the code to use this value instead of the currently assigned value. See https://discord.com/channels/1229106258749948056/1296827364021370900/1296827364021370900 for a video about this process

card-dealer.title: Tune Card Holder and Flywheel
card-dealer.message: This video starting from this timestamp shows how to tune the Card Dealer's gate to only let one card through, and how to make sure the flywheel is set to the correct height: https://youtu.be/qxBkah9Xl2U?list=TLGGcGXJaJUePXMyNzA0MjAyNQ&t=1518

card-dealer.title: Fix shooting multiple cards
card-dealer.message:
If your card dealer is shooting multiple cards, there are two likely reasons:

1. You need to tune your IR sensor so it knows when it has shot a single card, see this spot of the build video: https://youtu.be/qxBkah9Xl2U?list=TLGGcGXJaJUePXMyNzA0MjAyNQ&t=1556

2. You need to tune your card dealer's gate to only let a single card through, see this spot of the build video: https://youtu.be/qxBkah9Xl2U?list=TLGGcGXJaJUePXMyNzA0MjAyNQ&t=1518

card-dealer.title: Cards Getting Stuck at flywheel
card-dealer.message:
Try these three solutions:
1. Make sure you have the screws anchoring your servo as in step 24 of the instructions, see https://discord.com/channels/1229106258749948056/1364009252326211676/1366226275211022359

2. Push the flywheel further out, rather than having it as close to the wood.

3. Try reducing friction by putting standard scotch tape on the bottom of the card holder as seen here https://discord.com/channels/1229106258749948056/13640092creat52326211676/1366228201491136594.

card-dealer.title: Not recognizing color tagged player positions
card-dealer.message:
If your card dealer is not stopping at each color, most likely you need to tune your color sensor. See this spot in the build video for how to do this: https://youtu.be/qxBkah9Xl2U?list=TLGGcGXJaJUePXMyNzA0MjAyNQ&t=1628

Turn the screw as far counter-clockwise as you possibly can. 
Both the D3 and the D2 lights should be on.
Then slowly rotate the screw clockwise until the D3 light turns off
